alert.note: Alert for Sanilac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 5:34PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Sanilac County through 630 PM EDT... At 534 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Kingston, or 8 miles north of Marlette, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Sandusky around 600 PM EDT. Deckerville around 605 PM EDT. Carsonville around 620 PM EDT. Applegate around 625 PM EDT. Port Sanilac around 630 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Decker, Palms, Watertown, McGregor, Forester, Snover, Juhl, Elmer and Richmondville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
